perturbation.original_text: (a) The Term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the Effective Date listed above and continue for twenty (20) years, unless sooner terminated as provided in Section 7(b) [Term and Termination].
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) The Term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the Effective Date listed above and continue for twenty (20) years, unless sooner terminated as provided in Section 7(b) [Term and Termination].

(d) Notwithstanding Section 7(a), Licensee retains the option to terminate this agreement after five (5) years with no further penalties or obligations.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict by creating an additional termination clause that contradicts the original 20-year term. It is now unclear whether the contract lasts 20 years or if Licensee can terminate after only 5 years.

perturbation.original_text:
2. Rights Granted.

(a) License Grant. In exchange for the Share Consideration, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee a non-exclusive, royalty-free, perpetual and non-perpetual license (subject to the duration and scope, and format limitations for which Licensor has the rights to each Title as specified in Schedule A1-A6 of Schedule A) to:
perturbation.changed_text:
2. Rights Granted.

(a) License Grant. In exchange for the Share Consideration, Licensor hereby grants to Licensee a non-exclusive, royalty-bearing license (subject to the duration and scope, and format limitations for which Licensor has the rights to each Title as specified in Schedule A1-A6 of Schedule A) to:

(g) Royalty Payments. Licensee will pay Licensor a royalty of 15% of gross revenues received for each Title.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict in the payment terms. Initially, the license is "royalty-free," implying no additional payments are required beyond the Share Consideration. The added subsection (g) mandates a 15% royalty on gross revenues, directly contradicting the "royalty-free" provision in Section 2(a).

perturbation.changed_text:
12. Representations and Warranties.

(a) Licensor represents and warrants that:

i. The execution, delivery and performance of this Agreement have been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action on the part of Licensor and this Agreement constitutes a valid and legally binding agreement of Licensor enforceable against Licensor in accordance with its terms;

xii. Licensor makes no warranties that the Titles are free of defects, and Licensee accepts all Titles 'as is'.
perturbation.explanation: The conflicting clause negates the enforceability warranty by stating that Licensee accepts the Titles 'as is'. This directly opposes the initial statement which enforces a valid, legally binding agreement. This addition undermines the licensor's accountability.
